alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Lamoille; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 4:17PM EDT until July 09 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Washington County in central Vermont... Western Caledonia County in northeastern Vermont... Southeastern Lamoille County in northwestern Vermont... * Until 730 PM EDT. * At 417 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Woodbury, Elmore, Wolcott, Hardwick, Calais, Worcester, South Woodbury, North Calais, East Calais, Maple Corner, Kents Corners and Hardwick Center. Radar indicates that 2 to 3 inches of rain has already fallen in the warned area. Additional rainfall is likely in the next 1 to 2 hours. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
